At the next prompt, I am going to provide you with 20 entries from a spreadsheet describing digital resources for archaeology.


We need to improve the data in the following ways:


improve its description to a 50-100 word description

decide if the following tool definition applies

For our project, a software tool is any discrete piece of software—be it a program, script, or web application—that is developed or substantially modified by researchers to perform specific, research-oriented computational tasks. These tasks must involve active data processing, such as analysis, simulation, visualization, modeling, or automation, where input data is dynamically created, documented, transformed, or interpreted to generate meaningful results. In contrast, products whose primary function is to simply display, store, or promote static datasets—without offering mechanisms for active computational engagement—are excluded.


In essence, a valid software tool for our purposes is one that not only supports research in archaeology or historical sciences but does so by actively collecting and/or processing data rather than merely serving as a generic data repository or static interface.


If the resource does meet this definition, please:


Add a new column named 'Tool' to the spreadsheet if it does not already exist.

Place the tag 'archhist-software-tool' in that 'Tool' Column to indicate that the resource met our definition of a tool.


Please ONLY write the 'archhist-software-tool' tag to the new 'Tool' Column, DO NOT place it in any other column.


Please output the updated CSV as a fenced code block.


Do you understand these instructions?

Lithics3D,"An R package for processing and analyzing 3D scans of archaeological lithics.","Lithics3D is an R package designed for the processing and analysis of 3D scans of lithic artifacts. cherish,"Cherish is a tool that aids archaeologists and designers to represent historical, urban and archaeological structures and sites in 3D by means of image manipulation and sketching. meshlab,"These tools are meant to help you render orthographic views of 3D models for archaeological publication by simplifying, segmenting, cleaning and rendering 3D meshes.","meshlab is a standalone software tool designed to process and render 3D meshes, specifically for archaeological publications. rti,"Series of common tols used by most Reflectance Transformation Imaging (RTI) projects, plus some custom programs to help with the workflow from the camera to the output.","rti is a collection of Python scripts that streamline the Reflectance Transformation Imaging (RTI) workflow. benmarwickDY-XYZ-data-on-an-irregular-grid-to-an-interpolated-raster.r,"Plotting remote sensing data, especially how to go from XYZ data on an irregular grid to an interpolated raster","benmarwickDY-XYZ-data-on-an-irregular-grid-to-an-interpolated-raster.r is an R script that converts XYZ data from irregularly spaced remote sensing grids into smooth, interpolated raster surfaces. BayLum,"An R package for chronological Bayesian models integrated for Optically Stimulated OSL, Luminescence Dating","BayLum is an R package designed for constructing chronological Bayesian models specifically tailored for Optically Stimulated Luminescence (OSL) dating. LumReader,"R package to simulate a Luminescence Reader","LumReader is an R package that simulates the operation of a luminescence reader for dating applications. shiny_Tldating,"Shiny app for TL dating","shiny_Tldating is an interactive Shiny web application built in R for thermoluminescence (TL) dating analysis. DRAC-calculator,"DRAC is a Dose Rate and Age Calculator which has been designed to calculate environmental dose rates (_) and ages for trapped charge dating applications","DRAC-calculator is a standalone software tool designed to compute environmental dose rates and age estimates for trapped charge dating applications. By automating complex computational tasks in luminescence dating, DRAC-calculator provides researchers with reliable, rapid outputs that support detailed chronological analyses in archaeological and geological studies.",yes
shiny_DRAC,"graphical interface for DRAC","shiny_DRAC is a standalone graphical interface designed for the DRAC dose rate and age calculator. It actively processes temporal data to generate standardized chronologies and supports conversions between time representations, thereby facilitating robust temporal analysis and visualization.",yes
tfqar,"Tools for Quantitative Archaeology - in R.","tfqar is an R package that provides a comprehensive suite of tools for quantitative archaeological analysis. It actively processes numerical data to perform statistical modeling, visualization, and hypothesis testing, enabling researchers to extract meaningful insights from complex datasets.",yes
arches,"Arches is a web platform for creating, managing, & visualizing geospatial data. Arches was inspired by the needs of the Cultural Heritage community, particularly the widespread need of organizations to build & manage cultural heritage inventories.","arches is a web-based platform that facilitates the creation, management, and visualization of geospatial data for cultural heritage purposes. While it offers robust tools for data collection and organization, its primary focus is on static data management rather than active computational processing, so it does not fully meet the criteria as a research-oriented software tool.",no
ADMUR,"Tools to directly model underlying population dynamics using chronological datasets (radiocarbon and other) with a variety of models, including Continuous Piecewise Linear (CPL) model framework, and model comparison framework using BIC. Package also calibrates 14C samples, and generates Summed Probability Distributions (SPD). CPL modelling directly estimates the most likely population trajectory given a dataset, using SPD simulation analysis to generate a Goodness-of-fit test for the best selected model.","ADMUR is an R package that models population dynamics using chronological datasets, including radiocarbon dates. It implements Continuous Piecewise Linear (CPL) models and employs Bayesian Information Criteria (BIC) for model comparison. Additionally, ADMUR calibrates radiocarbon samples and generates Summed Probability Distributions (SPD) to simulate population trajectories. By actively processing chronological data through advanced statistical methods, it provides robust insights into past population trends.",yes
ODK-forms-archaeology,"Forms for the Open Data Kit mobile data collection app.","ODK-forms-archaeology is a collection of digital forms designed for use with the Open Data Kit (ODK) mobile app in archaeological fieldwork. While these forms standardize data entry and facilitate field data collection, they primarily serve as templates and do not perform active computational analysis.",no
Fix-exif-artist,"Fix the Exif.Image.Artist tag based on user input depending from the camera model. Useful if you have a bunch of photographs from different people all mixed up.","Fix-exif-artist is a Python script that corrects the Exif.Image.Artist metadata tag in digital photographs. It actively processes image metadata by applying user-specified corrections based on camera model, ensuring accurate attribution across mixed collections. This automation enhances the reliability and organization of photographic archives in archaeological and cultural heritage projects.",yes
expotime,"What is the correlation between the exposure time of your photographs and the time of the day?","expotime is a Python script that investigates the correlation between photograph exposure times and the time of day. It actively extracts and analyzes metadata from digital images to identify trends in lighting conditions, helping researchers optimize photographic documentation and understand environmental influences on field imaging.",yes
zoolog,"Manipulate log-ratios (also known as log size index (LSI) values) from measurements obtained on zooarchaeological material.","zoolog is an R package designed for manipulating log-ratios, commonly referred to as log size index (LSI) values, derived from zooarchaeological measurements. It actively processes quantitative data to compute and analyze these ratios, thereby supporting detailed comparative studies of artifact size and morphology in zooarchaeology.",yes
iconr,"Set of formal methods for studying archaeological iconographic datasets (rock-art, pottery decoration, stelae, etc.) using network and spatial analysis.","iconr is an R package that implements formal methods for analyzing archaeological iconographic datasets such as rock art, pottery decoration, and stelae. It actively processes visual and spatial data to construct network models and perform spatial analyses, enabling researchers to quantitatively assess cultural symbolism and iconographic patterns.",yes
heurist,"A web-based data management infrastructure that allows researchers to design, create, manage, analyse and publish their own richly-structured database(s) through a simple web interface, without the need for programmers or consultants.","heurist is a web-based data management system that empowers researchers to design, create, and manage structured databases via an intuitive interface. anthropmmd,"An R package for Smith's Mean Measure of Divergence (MMD), with a graphical user interface, facilities for trait selection and graphical representations.","anthropmmd is an R package that implements Smith's Mean Measure of Divergence (MMD), a statistical tool used in cultural evolution studies.
